original_solution_mapping.L1: The books will cost $40 because 8 x 5 = <<8*5=40>>40
original_solution_mapping.L2: He needs to save up $27 because 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 305.
    Returns: the amount of money Tommy needs to save up.
    """
    # L1
    num_books = 8 # 8 new books
    cost_per_book = 5 # Each book costs $5
    total_cost_books = num_books * cost_per_book

    # L2
    money_already_has = 13 # already has $13
    money_needed_to_save = total_cost_books - money_already_has

    # FA
    answer = money_needed_to_save
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The books will cost ${total_cost_books} because {num_books} x {cost_per_book} = <<{num_books}*{cost_per_book}={total_cost_books}>>{total_cost_books}
He needs to save up ${money_needed_to_save} because {total_cost_books} - {money_already_has} = <<{total_cost_books}-{money_already_has}={money_needed_to_save}>>{money_needed_to_save}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: The books will cost $64 because 8 x 8 = <<8*8=64>>64
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He needs to save up $51 because 64 - 13 = <<64-13=51>>51

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'num_books' (8) was used instead of 'cost_per_book' (5).
